授業目的: Refer to the following
到達目標: Refer to the following
授業方法:
This class will be conducted face-to-face. 


Seminar format. Each week we will pursue one specific task, which we will try to achieve in collaboration with every student contributing to the class. There will be sufficient guidance and explanations given, which will enable the students to successfully work on and deliver their plenty assignments.

第1回: Introduction to the autumn course
第2回: Max Weber: Science as a Profession
第3回: Max Weber: Science as a Profession. Students’ presentations and discussion
第4回: Research and presentations of topics related to current issues in the European Union: Guide for researching and writing papers on European issues that will be researched and presented by students in class 5 to 14.
第5回:
Topic Spain: 


Countryside development and the rise of ghost towns: why investments in the countryside alone cannot save rural areas?
第6回:
Topic France: 


Why are the French eating better?
第7回:
Topic Denmark:


Why are the Danish the happiest people in the world?
第8回:
Topic Finland:


Are Finish children more intelligent – or why are they outperforming children around the world?
第9回:
Topic Baltic States: 


E-Administration. Are Estonia and the Baltic states leading the way to a digital society?
第10回:
Topic Norway and Iceland: 


Will Norway and Iceland be the first CO2 neutral countries?
第11回:
Topic Austria:


Why are there so many organic farmers in Austria?
第12回:
Topic UK: 


Changes in labour migration. Who is doing the jobs now after BREXIT?
第13回:
Topic Switzerland:


What keeps the country together?
第14回:
Topic Hungary:


Illiberal democracy: A new democracy model for Europe or its end?
トピック.授業外学習2: Critical text reading, searching for literature and other sources, preparation of presentations as well as preparation of homework will require considerable study time outside class!

評価.教科書Required texts0: Texts will be distributed in class
評価.参考文献・資料Reference books0: Information regarding reference books will be given in class
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school.
By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.
General Foundation Courses (Practical Orientation):
1. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
2. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
3. Ethical Values: Acquiring it though ‘liberal arts education for human growth’ based on Christian principles.

備考　Note
As a general rule, the credits will not be granted to students who miss more than one-third of the class sessions.
